author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: فِيْ سَماءِ مَشِيَّتِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ فَأَلْهِمْهُمْ عَجْزَ أَنْفُسِهِمْ تِلْقاءَ مَظْهَرِ نَفْسِكَ وَعَلِّمْهُمْ فَقْرَ ذَواتِهِمْ لَدَى ظُهُوراتِ غَنائِكَ وَاسْتِغْنائِكَ لِيَجْمَعُوا عَلَى أَمْرِكَ وَيَتَشَبَّثُوا بِذَيْلِ رَحْمَتِكَ وَيَتَمَسَّكُوا بِحَبْلِ إِرادَتِكَ،
translation: Inspire them, O my Lord, with a sense of their own powerlessness before Him Who is the Manifestation of Thy Self, and teach them to recognize the poverty of their own nature in the face of the manifold tokens of Thy self-sufficiency and riches, that they may gather together round Thy Cause, and cling to the hem of Thy mercy, and cleave to the cord of the good pleasure of Thy will.
